Title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Author: Bo Goldman
Lawrence Hauben
Ken Kesey

Replies.Reply: McMurphy! This is Doctor Shankle, from the infirmary. Can you hear me?
Why don't we blast 'im, for Christ sake, he ain't gonna come down...
as he herds the patients out of the day room. He turns to see McMurphy trying to open the screen. Miller crosses to McMurphy.
You goin' t'see the Big White Fathuh?
He goin' t'see the Big White Muthuh...
Haw, look at 'im, big 'nough to eat apples off my head an' he mine me like a baby...
Get your black ass in here!
You a good boy, Mistah Bancini...
Martini, there ain't nobody there, ya dumb goon! Go get the ball!
Le's go, Chief. Le's go get ourselves all nice and clean...
Nobody leaves here till seven thirty.
Shit, man, tha' ain't even worth considerin'.
Bibbit? Where's Bill Bibbit, ya damn goons?
'Kay, let's have the keys an' nobody get hurt!
Mean old Monday, Miss Pilbow, mean old Monday...
Time to get up! Come on now, it's a beautiful day! Let's not straggle!

Good morning, Mister Sefelt... Good morning, Mister Fredrickson. Good morning, Billy, I spoke to your mother last night and she sends her love... Good morning, Mister Harding... Good morning, Mister Cheswick. Mister Scanlon...
Mister Washington, why don't we get a good head start on the day by shaving Mister Bromden and see if we can't avoid a disturbance.
Will you come with me, please.
My name is Miss Ratched. I'm the head nurse here. You've already met Miss Pilbow and Aides Washington and Warren.
Mister Miller, this is Mister McMurphy, who'll be staying with us.
We do appreciate the way you have taken it upon yourself to meet the other patients.
This is your bed. You may leave your things in that cabinet.
Please use your time to familiarize yourself with your new home and if there is anything you need to know, don't hesitate to ask us.
All in good time, Mister McMurphy.
Good. Now if you'll just go along with Mister Washington, he'll see that you're properly oriented.
Good. I'm sure we'll be friends.
Yes. Now go along, Mister McMurphy.
Somebody please see to Mister Bancini, so we can start the meeting.
At the close of Friday's meeting, we were discussing Mister Harding's problem, concerning his wife...
Mister Harding stated that his wife made him uneasy because she drew stares from men on the street. Is that correct, Mister Harding?
He also thinks he may have given her reason to seek sexual attention elsewhere, but he didn't say how.
So. Does anyone care to touch upon this further?

Mister McMurphy, this ward is a democratic community run by the patients and their votes, so you should feel at ease in your new surroundings to the extent you can freely discuss emotional problems in front of the patients and staff.
Yes... We were discussing Mister Harding's problem with his wife.
Am I to take it that there isn't a man among you who has an opinion concerning this matter?
Have you ever speculated, Mister Harding, that you are impatient with your wife because she does not meet your mental requirements?
No secrets, Mister Harding. Let's get it all out in the open...
Mister McMurphy. Patients aren't allowed in here.
That music is for everyone, Mister McMurphy.

Mister McMurphy, there are old men here who couldn't hear the music at all if it were lower. That music is all they have, and I wish you wouldn't lean against the glass there, your hands are staining the window.
That's all right, Miss Pilbow, if Mister McMurphy does not wish to take his medication orally, he may...
Good morning, boys. Rise and shine.
Time to got up! Come on now, it's a beautiful day! Let's not straggle!
Good morning, Mister Sefelt, are your teeth any better?... Good morning, Mister Fredrickson... Good morning, Mister Harding; my, my, you've been biting your fingernails again...
Mister McMurphy, patients are not permitted to run around in towels.
Patients are rationed to one pack of cigarettes a day.
Now you boys hurry along and wash up for breakfast...
After breakfast, Mister McMurphy, after breakfast.
Yes. Now run along like a good boy and see that you wash up properly.
watching McMurphy who removes his towel as he enters the washroom.
You should have thought about that before you gambled all your cigarettes away. Is that clear?
Now, as I recall, we were making quite a bit of headway, last time, with Mister Harding's problem. So, does anyone care to begin?
The point is well taken, Doctor, but do we have the necessary personnel to cover a second day room?
Good. Good. Yes, yes, I think we should give it a trial period. So!
Please understand, the schedule has been set up for a delicately balanced reason that would be thrown into turmoil by a switch of routines.
Very well! All those in favor, please raise your hands.
I count only two, including you, Mister McMurphy. Certainly not enough to change ward policy.
Yes. Now was there anything else you wanted to discuss, Mister McMurphy?
Then I suggest we turn our attention back to Mister Harding's problem. Would anybody care to begin?
Was it your idea to visit her on Sunday?
What was it about her that disturbed you so, Billy?
Billy, were you afraid of her, or of her love?
That was the first time you attempted to commit suicide, wasn't it?
You must try to talk about it, Billy.
Mister McMurphy, the purpose of this meeting is therapy. Group therapy.
Let me pose a question to the group: do any of you feel that Mister McMurphy is perhaps imposing his personal desires on you too much?
Will one more vote satisfy you?
Very well. What is it you're proposing, Mister McMurphy?
A vote is before the group.
Everyone in favor of changing the schedule raise his hand.
I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, I count only eight.
But there are eighteen patients on the ward, Mister McMurphy.
I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, but you must have a majority to change ward policy.
You mean you don't want their votes to count, Billy!
I want you to turn the television off and return to your place!
I want you men to return to your proper places. The group meeting is not over!
Mister McMurphy, you are deliberately violating the rules!...
You boys, stop this and go to your assignments! Mister McMurphy, I want you to set an example...
Good. Well, boys, did you enjoy yourselves?
Mr. McMurphy, you had no right to take these men out with you!
That's quite a catch, Jim. Whaat are you going to do with it?
That's an excellent idea. Now, why don't you boys place your fish on the gurney and we'll see to it that everyone enjoys a fresh fish dinner.
Thank you, boys. Now if you'll just go along with Mister Washington to the showers, supper is in half an hour.
It's been brought to my attention that you're giving Mister Fredrickson your medication, aren't you, Mister Sefelt?
Now, Jim, you must be honest with yourself.
Sit down, Mister Cheswick, and wait your turn!
If the dorms were left open, you would just return to bed after breakfast...
With few exceptions, time spent in the company of others is therapeutic, while every minute spent brooding alone only increases separation.
Good. Why don't you join us?
No, miss, it's the other way around.
Miss, it's a complicated case. It would take too long to explain.
Billy, it's not polite to stare!
Mister Harding, have you seen Billy?
You should have thought about that before you brought that woman in here!
I don't want your mother to believe something like this but what am I to think?
Billy, that girl couldn't have pulled you in there forcibly...
Put him in Doctor Spivey's office!
Washington! Warren! To the day room, immediately!
Get away from him! Don't you dare touch him!
Did everything go well, Mister Sefelt?
No. Mister Harding, that is not true.
Now, let's find you a place to sit, shall we, Mister McMurphy?
Here now, you sit here... That's it...
Good morning, Miss Ratched. It's a beautiful day, isn't it?
Make yourself at home, Mister McMurphy...
When I first came here I was so scared of being lost I had to holler so they could track me... I figured anything was better than being lost...
Yes, sir, it's a mighty nice fall day...
I tell ya, these goons showered me at the courthouse this morning, last night at the jail, and I swear they'd have swabbed my ears out on the way over if they could've found the facilities...
Yes, sir, I sure am gonna enjoy my stay here.
Ya know, I ain't never been in an institution of psychology before.
Yeah, I'm here on a ninety-day observation period. Short-timer, like they say...
Man, there sure is an awful lot of poontang around here.
Yeah, I was just thinking the same thing, Doc...
Why, I'll betcha there must be a million albacore and tuna running of the coast right this minute.
Fish! Hell, Doc, I'd like to have a nickel for every fish I landed between Point Conception and the Alaska coast...
Yup! Worked right outta Depoe Bay for just about every season since I was able to haul my own weight.
Sorry, buddy, I'm clean outta change...
Hey, how's it look up there, big boy?
You look pretty healthy to me.
Hell, compared to where I just come from, this is a country club.
Shoot! No wonder you don't care nothin' 'bout showin' your hand.
Well, put 'er there, Billy boy, my name's McMurphy.
What I wanna know is who's the top loony around here?
I'm seeing what a busy man does.
Yessir, that's why I came to this establishment for, to bring you birds fun and entertainment 'round the gamin' table...
Easy now, don't smudge 'em, we got lots of games ahead of us...
Hold the fort down, will ya, fellas!
Now that you mention it, I sure would like to call my aunt up in Portland and tell 'er where I am so she can come visit me.
Just that I'm glad to be here, Miss Ratched. I really am.
Yeah, you ain't half so bad looking for a head nurse.

Hell, Doc, I've been everything from a hoopla man with a two-bit carny show to a top mechanic and bull goose catskinner for every gypo loggin' operation in the Northwest till the Army taught me what my natural bent was.
Yeah, but you know how society persecutes a dedicated man.
They say I'm a habitual hassler.
To tell the truth, ever since I found my natural callin' I done time in so many small-time jails I could write a brochure...
Doc, what can I tell ya?
No, this is my first trip, Doc.
Yeah, well, it just pains me somethin' awful to see a full growed man sloshing around in his own water...
Well, say, buddy, is that the usual pro-cedure for those Group Ther'py shindigs? Bunch of chickens at a peckin' party?
That's right, buddy. And you want to know who pecks the first peck?
Ah, come off it! It's that Big Nurse, that's who...
I'm not talking about Fred Yoong or Maxwell Jones, buddy, what I'm talkin' about is that crummy meeting and what that nurse did to you!
Did to you and all the rest of you guys.
What did I see 'cept a grown man gettin' whipped so bad he can't laugh anymore.
Tell 'er to go straight to hell!
She ain't peckin' at your eyes, buddy.
She's peckin' at your balls, buddy, at your ever-lovin' balls.
P.A. What the hell is that?
Tell 'er to go to hell anyway!
Is that your sense of humor or are you tryin' to say somethin'?
Back and forth, that's it. Shoot, man, we'll be takin' on the New York Knicks before we're through...
Hey-ya, hey-ya, come on, come on, I'm waitin' on you suckers, you hit or you sit...
Hit, you say? Well well well and with a king up, the boy wants a hit. Whadaya know.
That okay. I'll take your marker.
'Kay, all bets are down, let's wheel 'em an' deal 'em.
Big king... little deuce... another king... a lovely lady... big ten...
Wait a minute, Martini, I can't hear a thing.
Pardon me miss, but would you mind turning...
Pardon me, ma'am, can I ask you somethin'?
How 'bout turning off that music for a while so a man can hear himself think?
Well, say, how 'bout easin' it down a bit so a man don't have to shout!
What's the horse pill for, honey?
Look, miss, I don't like swallowing something without knowing what it is!
I'm not upset. All I wanna know, for the lovva Jesus...
No, that's okay, ma'am. Down it goes.
You boys seem to think you've got a champ in there, huh?
Hell, I couldn't get it up over old hatchet-face if ya paid me!
Yeah, an' I'm tellin' ya, she's just an icy-hearted over-the-hump gal who never got enough of the old wham-bam to straighten 'er out...
Chief? I wanna ask ya somethin'.
Oh, does the spearmint lose its flavor on the bedpost overnight?
Who the fuck stole my cigarettes!
Yeah, some creep stole my cigarettes!
Well, say. How 'bout springing a pack of cigarettes loose?
You sure run a tight-assed ship 'round here, don't ya!
'Kay, let's go brush our teeth, fellas...
Oh, Lulu had a baby, His name was Sunny Jim, She put 'im in a piss pot, To teach 'im how to swim.
Why, if I'd have known how soft this place was gonna be, I'd have arranged for my transfer sooner...
Don't know if I can hold it that long, Sam.
Who do you like in the opening game, Sam?

Right... I've been givin' some serious consideration to what you told me about the democratic something of this therapeutic community of ours, an' I got a few things I wanna get off my chest, before we get back to Harding's problem.

'Kay... Item one... I've been thinkin' 'bout the age problem we got on this ward. You know, the young an' old livin' together, an' I was thinkin' what a great thing it would be if the music was turned up louder. Louder so the old fellas could hear better...
But then I got to thinkin', the music is so loud already, it makes it difficult for the young fellas to hold a decent conversation...

Well, I was turnin' this dilemma over in my head, when I happened to hit on that old tub room out there, an' I said to myself, McMurphy, I said, that place would make a great second day room. A sort of game room for the young fellas. Whadaya think, Doc?

'Kay, item two. Tomorrow, and listen carefully to me, you ding-a lings. Tomorrow is the opening game of the World Series an' what I want is to take a vote on switchin' the group meetin' to later on in the day, so we can watch the ballgame.
The hell with the schedule, you can get back to the schedule next week when the series is over. What I want is a vote on it right now!
Come on', what is this crap? Who wants to watch the World Series?
You need four houses on every lot of the same color, Martini. Now let's go, for Christsakes.
Snake eyes! Hoooeee, that puts you on my Marvin Gardens, which means you owe me three hundred and fifty dollars.
You just come on with that three fifty and Martini will take care of himself... Your dice, Scanlon.
Break it up, God dammit! Ain't I got enough troubles without you guys messin' around... can't depend on nobody.
What's the use! Hooee! It'd do you birds some good just to get a little exercise lifting your arms to vote!
It is to me! An' if I hafta bust way outta this place to see it, I will!
Yeah, how much you wanna bet?
That me an' my buddy, Cheswick, we'll be downtown tomorrow watchin' the ballgame while you suckers are sittin' around this goddamn nursery!
That's between me an' myself. So why don't you boys just shove off.
Maybe I'll just use that thick skull of yours as a batterin' ram, Sefelt.
Put your money where your mouth is, Taber.
You want me to show ya! You want me to show ya how!
With this thing! I'm gonna put this thing right through the window, that's how!
You heard me the first time!
Stand aside, son. Any more takers?
Yeah... Okay, stand aside, you guys! You're usin' up my oxygen!
But I tried. Goddammit, I sure as hell did that much. Didn't I?
No, kid, it was my own stupidity, that's what pissed me off.
What we're gonna have to do is pull this ballclub together for our next play. 'Kay!
Jesus Christ, the man doesn't want to talk, so get off his back an' let's get on to some new business.
Yeah, yeah, the hell with that crap! The World Series is goin' on right' now an' that's therapy also!
What the hell does that have to do with it? This is an important event and I want a vote on it!
I'm proposing a re-vote on watchin' the ballgame!
Okay, I wanna see the hands. I wanna see which of you birds has any guts.
You mean to tell me you're gonna count those old birds over there?
Hoo-wee! Man, all I need me now is a can of beer and a red-hot.
A hit! It's a hit! He's rounding first, heading for second. Here comes the throw. He's sliding...
He's into his wind-up. Here comes the pitch. Strike on the inside corner!
He's into his wind-up. Here's the next pitch... and it's a hit! It's a hit!
'Kay, it's two outs, bases loaded as Koufax steps up to the mound...
Just fine, Doc... In fact, I think I might've put on a couple of pounds since I got here.
Come on, Doc, you know as well as I do what's been comin' down in that loony bin.
Shoot, Doc, the only one I'm disturbing is that old nurse and her fixed ways. That's all.
Come on, Doc, you must be kiddin'.
Jesus, that old nurse sure wants my ass in a sling, don't she!
Guidance and assistance! That's insane! Doc, ya gotta help me.
Okay, Chief. This is your spot! I don't want you to move from this spot! Never!... 'Kay, now, take the ball! Raise your hands, like this...
That's good! That's a good boy, Chief! Now jump and put it in!
I know, goddammit! You don't have ta tell me that!
I'm not talkin' to him! I'm talkin' to myself! It helps me think!
Well, it doesn't hurt him either!
Let me get on your shoulders.
'Kay, wheel me around to the basket... 'Kay, easy, easy. Hold it! 'Kay, now.
Now, wheel me to the basket.
Hey, Billy. Billy boy, wake up and say goodbye to your ol' buddy.
Shhhh. See ya around the ball park.
So long, Freddy. Don't take any wooden nickles.
Shhh... That's for me to know an' you to find out.
Let's go! An' keep it quiet.
Out. It's the way out. So just keep it in your minds if ya ever wanna make use of it.
Shhh. Wait a minute. You guys are gonna screw up my plans. So just gone on back to bed like nothin' happened.
Shhh. Hold it down! I'll take you guys down, but ya gotta come right back up! 'Kay?
Shhh... Remember this is a privilege, so I don't want none of you goons fuckin' up. Kay?
Charlie, ya can't ever let those goons outta ya sight! Understand!
Hey, Martini! Psst! Scanlon! Ya dumb goons, come back here!
Come on, you guys, let's stick together.
We'll go back just as soon as we find those guys! 'Kay?
Come on, don't crap out on me now.
Hey, you guys, come on up here and take a gander at this!
Well, shoot, man! Whadaya say we take ourselves a little spin around the place.
I'm not going back in there. I told ya this was a one way trip. Now stand aside.
Your horses are hungry, That's what she did say, Come sit down beside me, An' feed them some hay.
I dunno. Where do ya wanna go?
Breakfast! Hell, I know just the place where we can chow down an' thaw out before we shoot back on home. 'Kay?
Come on in an' warm up. You can put some of that gear on to keep warm.
Come on, don't be shy now, you're among friends.
Why don't one of you boys help ol' Chief there get warmed up?
Come here a minute, Cheswick. You, too, Sefelt. Hey, all you guys, come over here, I wanna show you somethin'.
Yeah, did you ever see a boat like that? Why, I'll bet you could go all the way to Hawaii in that boat!
Ease up on the star drag, keep the tie up, up and work hell outta that fella.
Up, I told you! Keep that tip up...
He's a big flounder. Could weigh two, three hundred. You got to lift him in with a winch.
Like hell we will! We got the muscle standing right here. All we need is a couple gaffin' hooks and some rope.
Yeah, ya should've come along with us, Miss Ratched, an' gotten a little sun on your cheeks and maybe caught a fish or two.
Yeah, that's kind of crazy, ain't it!
I'm sure sorry, ma'am. Gawd, but I am. That window glass was so clean I didn't even see it...
You guys want cigarettes! Here's the goddamn cigarettes!

Yeah, well, well, well. 'Bout time the rest of the world got a gander at Big Chief Bromden cuttin' down the boulevard, stopping just long enough for virgins... Oh, man, I tell you, I tell you, you'll have women trippin' you and beating you to the floor...
Shhh, Chief, don't talk. Never talk! Remember, this is just between you an' me. Do ya understand?
You know, I never got your name.
You comin' in to hold my hand?
Yeah... Well, see ya around, Itsu.
You boys can take a cigarette break now...
Surely, goodness and mercy will follow this, eh, honey?
I got ten thousand watts and hot to trot. First woman takes me on is gonna light up like a pinball machine an' pay off in silver dollars...
Just fine, Billy boy, just fine.
Ma'am, I'm as gentle as a puppy dog. Why, I haven't licked the tar out of an aide for two weeks! Hi ya, Doc!
Yeah, well, let me tell ya somethin'... While I was up there gettin' in-lightened, I came up with one hellava plan...
Miss Ratched, would you please save a space for my aunt? She's comin' down from Portland.
Hey, Sam, bet ya two bucks ya lose.
Come on, wake up, you ding-a-lings.
Ya deaf! I said pass the ball!
I was open! Come on, let's play ball!
What kind of crap is that???
Get down there where ya belong, Martini. You, too, Scanlon.
How's your ass been holdin' up, honey?
Come on, girls, we're holding up the game!
Miss Ratched, this is my Aunt Candy and her friend Rose...
Miss Ratched was kind enough to save you ladies a seat...
Talk to ya at half time!
Whadaya doin', there's no one there!
Okay, Martini. That's okay. Now you watch me.
Ya fuckin' coon, you're not on the ward now!
We got your black ass now, Washington, wanna bet another twenty?
Our prayers have been answered, Turkle! Our prayers have been answered!
I tell ya, there's an angel of mercy standing out there, Turkle.
Now, wouldn't you pray for twenty bucks, a bottle booze an' a piece of that angel cake?
Man, you look good 'nough to eat!
He can't hear you, Rose. He's just a big deaf an' dumb indian...
Sure, I know Chuck. I know him.
Sure, she understands what you mean. She's not dumb. Why do you think Rose came to visit us? Rose is very interested in hospitals and hospital facilities. Aren't you, Rose?
Yeah, that's a good idea, Turkle.
Who knows what evil lurks in the hearts of men...
Ellis ain't gonna hurt you... Ellis is nice... Nice Ellis... see the nice lady...
There, see, nice lady touch Ellis...
Don't worry 'bout the road! We'll hit the road! It'll be there when we're ready!
I jus' want you guys to have a good time... Are ya havin' a good time?
Whadaya want? Ya wanna drink? A cigarette...
Candy? Hell no, Billy, she's just a good friend, that's all...
Go on, son, now's your chance...
Come on, you lovers, it's gettin' late...
It's okay, kid. Everything it going to be okay... I'll come back an' getcha in a while... 'Kay...
Hey, Harding, wake me in an hour.
Hey, Billy, stop cryin'. You don't have to cry... You ain't got nothin' to be ashamed of. She ain't gonna tell you mother... stop crying...
Oh, do you do much fishing?
My, my... Ah, who are you?
Ah, yes. Well, we must talk soon, Mister McMurphy.
Good morning, Jim. How are you feeling?
Have you been taking your Dilantin, Jim?
Well, we'll send you over to the dentist and see what he can do.
What other work have you done?
Yes... Ah, do you know why you're here?
What do you think of that report?
Arrested on an assault charge five times...
The doctor at the prison states: 'Don't overlook the possibility that this man may be faking psychosis to escape the drudgery of the work farm...' What do you say to that?
Ah, it seems you have no other psychiatric history, Mister Murphy?
Well, you're here for a ninety-day observation period, Mister McMurphy. I'd like you to understand you are here on a court order and we are responsible to the state. So, I'd like your cooperation!
It is worth considering... Miss Ratched?
Well, since it will be largely the Chronics who remain here, one aide and one nurse should easily be able to handle any situation that might occur.
What do you think, men, is it workable?
Good, good, and how are you getting along on the ward?
Yes, well, Miss Ratched feels that you're a disturbing influence on the other patients.

Yes, that may be so, but in making a careful study of your past record, along with your behavior since you arrived here, my feeling is that you are not mentally ill and it is going to be my recommendation that you be returned to Pendleton where they are better equipped to handle your case.
No, Mister McMurphy, it's just that we cannot offer you the guidance and assistance that you would receive at Pendleton.
I'm sorry, but I can't keep you here.
Here they are, Miss Ratched. Safe and sound!
Me? I didn't hear a thing! Let's play ball!
Mister McMurphy is a new admission.
Yes, yes, Mister Bancini, now if you'll just be calm...
Stay back! Patients aren't allowed to enter the... Oh, stay back!
Oh, stay back, I'm a Catholic!
It's just medication, Mister McMurphy, good for you. Now down it goes...
Yeah, Harding, where do you breathe anyway?
That kind of behavior will get you a P.A. rating, my friend.
Maybe he'll just show Miss Ratched his big thing an' she'll open the door for him.
Why, my head would just squash like an eggplant, McMurphy.
Yes, I see it! I see it!
Yeah, my feet are gettin' cold.
Oh, my God! I see something!
I thought I might donate it to the mess hall.
It's the Dilantin that makes my gums soft!
McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped...
I want you to write me a letter to my brother for a hundred dollars to bury me.
Yeah, Harding, why don't you knockoff the bullshit and get to the point.
Yeah, Harding, you're so fuckin' dumb I can't believe it.

You know what, Harding? I think you're some kind of morbid asshole or something. You've been talking about your wife evere since I can remember. You know, she's on your mind and blah, blah, blah and on and on and when are you going to wise up and turn her loose!
Yeah, whattsa matter, Mack, she too much for ya?
Yeah, you don't know how to get outta this place!
Yeah, yeah, you're a fucking phony, McMurphy!
Yeah, yeah, show me. Show me how!
I'll bet a buck you don't do it!
Bullshit. You ain't got no way out!
Yeah, take us back to the dumbwaiter, Mac.
Yeah, why can't a fellow even have the weekends to himself?
Can you borrow me a dime?
I get it! I get it!
Hold it a minute. What's a man need to buy thum hotels?
What's thum other things? Hold it a minute. What's thum other things all over the board?
I saw thum! I saw thum!
Oh, look at the pretty boat.
All gone! All gone! Don't hit!
He can't hear you. He's just a deaf and dumb Indian!
Gimme those dice. I'll blow this board to pieces. Here we go...
Lebenty leben, count me over eleven, Martini...
Not that one, you crazy bastard, that's my house...
Yeah, that Gary Blinker is fulla shit...
Well, if you gentlemen will excuse me, I have some pressing matters to attend to.
Yes, Miss Ratched, this is correct.
I can only speculate as to the reasons why.

Miss Ratched. Given all the conditions of that sublime relationship, coupled with the subsequent annihilation of all that I held to be sacred, mentally, physically and emotionally, the only thing that I can speculate on, at this late date, is how I will justify the very existence of my life, with or without my dear wife.
The point is, I will carry on until I fully understand what the function of that relationship is regardless of form or content.
Is that your sense of humor or are you trying to say something?
I don't know. I don't know, but it makes me feel very peculiar when you throw in something like that.

I mean, the other day you made an allusion to my wife and the possible sexual problems we might be having. I know that to be the case, but the way in which you broached it, if that's your idea of teaching me something...
... or making me aware of a condition in my life, then I say, categorically speaking, the hell with you, Taber!
It's as simple as that. You've been on our ward six hours and have already simplified the work of Freud, Jung and Maxwell Jones in one grand analogy: it's a pecking party.
Miss Ratched is a competent psychiatric nurse, not some, some kind of monster pecking out our eyes!
And if you persist in your ways, they can always ship you over to Medical Surgery.
Now, what would I be trying to say?
Why didn't you tell her to go to hell, lover boy?
I don't see you scoring any points, buddy. And you're just the man for the job, right?
She's not all that homely, Mister McMurphy. In fact, she must have been a rather beautiful young lady.

Yes, thank you, Miss Ratched. Since our last meeting I have been reflecting, quite seriously, on the nature of my problem. Naturally, I'm referring to the capacity to obtain the necessary results in order to obtain... No, no. To personify the very existence of that relationship regardless of the function...
A baseball game isn't worth the risk, my friend.
And how do you propose to accomplish that little feat, my friend?
You mean you're going to try to pick that thing up and shove it through the window?
So why are you talking to him?
Well, I think you're just confusing him...
That's nice. Send me a post card.
I'm not running a charity ward...
Pass it! Pass it! I'm open, McMurphy, pass the ball!
Big Ace... a lovely lady... another ace... an' a little trey, hey, hey, whadaya say... hit or sit?
Is it true McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped yesterday?
Y-Y-You m-mean th-the pr-president of the P-P-Patients C-Council?
H-H-Harding, the m-m-man w-wants to t-talk to you, y-you're the pr-pr pr...
I-I-I-I-I d-d-don't s-s-see how anyone could lu-lu-lu-love a man who t-t-t-talks the way he does.
Y-y-yes! Yes! Y-y-y-you s-s-saw wh wh-what she c-c-can do to us!
Some of us ha-ha-have b-b-been here a long t-t-time, Randle, and will b b-be here long after this Wo-Wo World Series of yours is oh-oh-oh, what's the use anyway...
M-M-Mack, y-y-y-you c-c-can't l-l lift that thing!

I-I-I-I c-c-c-came over S-S-S Sunday m-m-m-morning after ch-ch-ch church and br-br-brought her s-s some flowers, and I s-s-said, I said, 'C-C-C-Celia, will you muh muh-muh-muh-muh...' till the girl broke out l-l-laughing.
I was in luh-love with her.
B-But, M-M-Miss R-Ratched, y-you n never c-c-counted th-their votes before!
I-I-I th-th-think we sh-sh-should go back!
I-I d-d-don't know! M-M-Miss R Ratched g-g-g-g...
C-C-Come here and l-look at th this!
W-W-We h-heard y-you w-were n-never c-c-coming back!
Ah-ah-ah-are y-y-y-you g-g-g-going t-t-t-to muh-muh-muh-marry her?
Wu-wu-wu I-I-I-I th-th-think sh-sh sh-she's th-th-th-the ma-ma-ma-most bu-bu-bu-beautiful wu-wu-wu-woman in th-th-the whole world!
C-C-Candy, wu-wu-will y-y-you mu-mu marry me!
P-p-p-please du-du-du-don't t-t tell her, p-p-please...
N-n-n-n-no, no, I du-du-du-didn't, I didn't!
P-p-p-please duh-duh-duh-duh t-t tell, M-M-M-Miss R-R-Ratched, y-y you don't need to!
Yeah, do you have an appointment?
She won't give me any more cigarettes!
I wanna know about my cigarettes!
How can a man concentrate with you sitting there hallucinating a mile a minute...
Yeah, maybe we ought to go back, Mac...
When do you think we'll be going back, Mack?
I'm tired. Whew. O Lord. Oh, I'm awful tired...
Tired. Tired. Oh God, I'm tired...
You see... it's a lotta baloney...
That's all it is, just a lotta baloney. Ya see, I can't help it, can't...
... don't ya see. I was born dead.
Now what would I be trying to say?
Which gets you shipped up to Disturbed for a nice little zap job.
We'll never get that on the boat.
Does that mean we have to cut him loose?
Show her the one you caught, Jim.
I wanna know why the dorm has to be locked in the daytime and on weekends?
So what? Is it a mortal sin? I mean, normal people get to sleep late on weekends...
Christ, they even got my first grade report card here...
Yeah, who do you think you are anyway?... He thinks he's God Almighty... He's a snob... He's a schmuck... Dumbbell... Creep...
Zap him... Give 'im lobotomy... Cut his nuts off... He doesn't have any... Fag... Pervert.
Le's get back to bed, Mistah Bromden...
What you boys doin' up at this ungodly time o' the night?
Well, you boys finish it up an' climb back into your beds. 'Kay?
I thought I told you boys to go to bed!
Hallelujah, brother, now get back in bed!
That angel of mercy, he ain't a she, is he?
Ah believe ya, brother. Ah believe ya!
Ah'm on my knees, brother, ah'm on my knees.
Hey, Mac! Gimme a hand, will ya!
Shhh... let's move it away from the window...
Oh, that. That ain't nothin' to be afraid of, ma'am. Just ol Chief Bromden. That's all...
They're sleeping, Miss. They're sleeping. An' we gotta keep it down so we don't disturb their sleep.
Oh, no, Miss. Not these loonies.
Shhh, please, Miss. Keep it down...
Well, Miss... I would say... I would say, yes. Yes, he's crazy.
Oh, I see. He was a very sick man.
I don't know anything about that, Miss. I would have to examine you first...
Well, I'm running a risk by letting you in, Miss. You know I'm runnin' a risk of gettin' my black ass fired. If you understand what I mean...
I'll be very glad to show you around, Miss...
Now, Miss. What do you want with twenty zombies when you got a twenty gun salute looking you right in the face.
You better believe it, you sweet little thing. You better believe it...
Oh, I'm all through talkin'. Now, let's just you an' me trip on down that hall.
That's all I'm going to show you.
You crazy goons... shut up an' get outta here... Out! Out! Out!
Shit, it's the soo-per-visor come to fire my black ass.
Get back in there! In! In! In!
Stay in there! Stay in there!
Alla ya goons, get in here!
Cleanliness is a twenty-four-hour job, ma'am...
Ah guess the natives are restless, ma'am...
Ah, no, ma'am... well, yes, ma'am...
A man get awful lonely at night, if ya know what Ah mean, ma'am...
No, I ain't no kid to have my cigarettes keep from me like cookies! Ain't that right, Mack!
All right! Stand to! Stand to!
Come on, Joey... this isn't going to hurt you... good for you... make you feel better...
That's all right, Mister McMurphy, just climb on the bed and lie down...
This won't hurt you at all...
Please, put this in your mouth...

Doctor Spivey is at half-court, basketball in hand as the players take up their positions: Washington faces McMurphy for the jump at center. Harding and Billy are playing guard with Warren and Miller on them. Martini and Scanlon are in the forward position, with the two white Aides covering them.
Mack, you sonofabitch, you ol' fucker, how've you been?
Yeah, well, he looks like hell!
Yeah, well you look like hell warmed over...
Pssst! Hey Rose! There they are!
It's okay, Rose. You can go with him.
Shit, Rose! What's there to decide?
Go with him, Rose. Go with him.
It's time to hit the road, Mack...
Come on, come on, let's go!
Whoowe, Candy girl, are we in an insane asylum or ain't we?
Oh, just those guys dressed in white?
Is he one of the loonies?
Hi ya, big boy? How's it goin'?
Are they dangerous when they're awake?
Smells like piss. Is this real, Candy? Is this really real? I mean we are in an insane asylum, an' I wanna know how we got ourselves into this scene.
Yeah, well, I'll tell ya somethin'.

Well, listen to this. He got mad at me one day. Boy, did he get mad at me. He took the light bulb, ya know. I thought he was going to cram it right up me, ya know. But he ate it. He ate the whole fucking light bulb.
Now, tell me! Is he crazy? Tell me!
That's what I told his mother. And she said I was crazy. Her son ate the whole fucking light bulb and she said I was crazy.
Oh yeah! Well if ya don't mind, I'll decide on my own date!
Whaddaya talkin' about? There's at least twenty guys in there. Let's wake 'em up and get this party on the road.
Don't you sweet talk me you ol' spook, you!
Well, okay, but I just want to look at the facilities. That's all.
Great shot, Chief! Ya okay? You're doin' great!
Big Nurse shakes her head and exits, closing the door behind her.

The office is splattered with blood. Billy is lying face up, hanging over Spivey's desk, dead. His throat and both wrists are cut. A broken picture frame, containing a photograph of Spivey's family, lies nearby.
